timeline.bodyText:
Hmm I'd suggest logging some kind of error message if ImageIO.read returns null.
Otherwise map makers might not realize that an invalid image was attempted to get loaded
timeline.author: RoiEXLab

replies.bodyText:
Hello, that's my first PR so i'm not entirely sure how to proceed from here :)
About the logs, I guess you are right, the caller should handle the null but an error log should indicate exactly what happened (maybe that image was invalid?).
replies.author: tjrbrom

replies.bodyText:
I confess I really don't know exactly in what circumstances this null might occur.
Going deeper into the library, we can see that ImageIO.read() method can return null, if "bi = read(stream)" results in null (line 1420)
replies.author: tjrbrom

replies.bodyText:
From the javadocs of ImageIO#read:

If no registered ImageReader claims to be able to read the resulting stream, null is returned.

This seems to be the case if the provided Image format is not supported.
So my suggestion would be to add an if-check that checks for null, and in case it is actually null the logger is called something like this:
log.severe("Unsupported Image Format: " + url);
Maybe you can come up with a better wording for the error message
replies.author: RoiEXLab

timeline.message: Log an error when reading the image URL resource from ImageIO returns null.
